Name: Malifaux: An Oni's Wrath – Asami Box Set
Description:
Asami has experienced more pain in her relatively few years than most people are capable of enduring in a lifetime. As a child, she saw faint lights which she knew came from Beyond. To guard her from judgment, her father kept her isolated. Asami grew lonely and yearned for the day she would have a family of her own.

Following an attack on her family shrine, she lost not only her father but also her fertility, and with it, the hope of creating her own family. Mortally wounded, Asami let the Amanjaku inside her soul, bestowing her with the bestial power of the oni – power which escalated as she let the demon even deeper within her, lured on by its promise to grant her a child. The exchange was a dark pact; the ravenous maw splitting the back of her head is both a constant reminder of her own insatiable hunger for the life she lost and the cruel mark of her oni manipulator.

The Ten Thunders have recruited Asami into their number, hoping to use her demonic strength for themselves, but whether they will be able to control her is another matter entirely.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing six 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic, Stat Cards and Upgrade Cards. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Asami Tanaka
    Amanjaku
    Ohaguro Bettari
    3 Yokai

Stat Cards

Asami Tanaka
    Amanjaku
    Ohaguro Bettari
    3 Yokai

Name: Malifaux: Dawn Serpent
Description:
A native of Earth, Dawn Serpents were brought through the breach by the Ten Thunders to further their plans. Unfortunately one or two may have escaped...
—description from the publisher

Name: Malifaux: Fermented River Monks
Description:
The Fermented River Monks are jolly fellows high on life (and copious amounts of alcohol) that also happen to be members of the Tri-Chi clan, where the Brewmaster happens to be a VIG (Very Important Gremlin) in. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Malifaux: Fuhatsu
Description:
Fuhatsu was a great warrior before the accident... Now he is a rage filled madman with a huge Gatling Gun that can't even keep his pants up. Basically, Fuhatsu is a very hard to take down firebase and has potential for insane firepower, though he has no melee presence whatsoever.
—description from the publisher

Name: Malifaux: Jorogumo
Description:
Jorogumo is a mysterious giant Spider like man creature and a minion for the Ten Thunders faction. Fast on his multiple arachnid legs, he also can put out an awesome amount of damage and he has a top-notch resilience stat as well. This all sounds too good to be true, well not if you look at the hefty fee it will cost you to hire him.

Ten Thunder Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic, Stat Cards. Will require some preparation and assembly.
—description from the publisher

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – For Honor and Glory
Description:
Expand your Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game collection with For Honor and Glory, the second Dynasty Pack of the "Imperial Cycle"!

Each of the seven Great Clans receives new cards that continue to embrace and define the themes that began in the Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game. Along the way, you'll  find a great assortment of cards focused on the Imperial City of Otosan Uchi. From neutral samurai sworn to the Imperial family, to Imperial magistrates from each of the Great Clans, to rewards for holding the Imperial Favor, this cycle draws you into the world of Otosan Uchi and the service of the Emperor.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Into the Forbidden City
Description:
Expand your Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game collection with Into the Forbidden City, the third Dynasty Pack of the "Imperial Cycle"!

Each of the seven Great Clans receives new cards that continue to embrace and define the themes that began in the Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game. Along the way, you'll  find a great assortment of cards focused on the Imperial City of Otosan Uchi. From neutral samurai sworn to the Imperial family, to Imperial magistrates from each of the Great Clans, to rewards for holding the Imperial Favor, this cycle draws you into the world of Otosan Uchi and the service of the Emperor.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – The Chrysanthemum Throne
Description:
Expand your Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game collection with Der Chrysanthementhron, the fourth Dynasty Pack of the "Imperial Cycle"!

Each of the seven Great Clans receives new cards that continue to embrace and define the themes that began in the Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game. Along the way, you'll  find a great assortment of cards focused on the Imperial City of Otosan Uchi. From neutral samurai sworn to the Imperial family, to Imperial magistrates from each of the Great Clans, to rewards for holding the Imperial Favor, this cycle draws you into the world of Otosan Uchi and the service of the Emperor.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Fate Has No Secrets
Description:
Expand your Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game collection with Das Schicksal kennt keine Geheimnisse, the fifth Dynasty Pack of the "Imperial Cycle"!

Each of the seven Great Clans receives new cards that continue to embrace and define the themes that began in the Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game. Along the way, you'll  find a great assortment of cards focused on the Imperial City of Otosan Uchi. From neutral samurai sworn to the Imperial family, to Imperial magistrates from each of the Great Clans, to rewards for holding the Imperial Favor, this cycle draws you into the world of Otosan Uchi and the service of the Emperor.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Meditations on the Ephemeral
Description:
Expand your Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game collection with Meditations on the Ephemeral, the sixth Dynasty Pack of the "Imperial Cycle"!

Each of the seven Great Clans receives new cards that continue to embrace and define the themes that began in the Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game. Along the way, you'll  find a great assortment of cards focused on the Imperial City of Otosan Uchi. From neutral samurai sworn to the Imperial family, to Imperial magistrates from each of the Great Clans, to rewards for holding the Imperial Favor, this cycle draws you into the world of Otosan Uchi and the service of the Emperor.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Wilde Tiere: Schnipp Schnapp
Description:
The wild animals meet at the watering hole. But only one of each animal type can be there at a time. If there are two of the same animal then: be quick and hit the crocodile in the watering hole with your hand! The fastest player receives all the animals that are at the watering hole. Who will manage to have all the animal cards at the end?
A wild reaction game.

Name: Drache Donnerzahn: Quartett
Description:
Dragon Rapid Fire and his friends are playing quartet today! Who wants to join in? With a little concentration and the right amount of luck, you can collect four of the same cards to form a quartet. The reward is a fire crystal. Who can collect the most fire crystals?
A dragon-strong card game classic.

Name: Pirat & Co: Mau Mau
Description:
Four brave pirates are on a wild race to the legendary Treasure Island. Each of them is trying to be the first to get rid of all their cards. But only a player with plenty of luck and the right tactics will win the round, and be allowed to sail their ship toward Treasure Island. Who will win the race?
A classic card game on the high seas.

Name: Ben's Building Site: Dominoes
Description:
Ben is happy to be at his building site. But oh no! What on earth happened here? The digger is next to the building site sign, the truck is behind the cement mixer. Who can help Ben get the chaos on the building site organized and place the items neatly next to each other? With a little luck and a good overview you can be the first to get rid of all your cards.
An arranging game for hard-workers.

Name: Android: Netrunner – Down the White Nile
Description:
What Jinteki secrets does Jinja hold? Down the White Nile is the second Data Pack in the "Kitara Cycle" for Android: Netrunner – The Card Game, and its sixty cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) reinforce the Kitara Cycle's focus on the tense interactions between Corp and Runner. These interactions hinge largely upon the secrets Jinteki's locked behind the doors of its Kisu2 Hospital. Bacteria and viruses (both physical and virtual) feature heavily, as do a new Shaper identity, new programs, ice, ambushes, and agendas that pay the Corp even if they're stolen.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Kingsmoot
Description:
In the tradition of the other Chapter Packs of the "Flight of Crows" cycle, Kingsmoot contains sixty new cards, offering brand-new characters, locations, attachments, and events for the eight factions of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. As the story of the cycle continues to follow A Feast for Crows, you'll see characters like Ramsay Snow, Raff the Sweetling, Jhiqui, and Darkstar entering the game, alongside two new neutral Brotherhood characters. As the bestow keyword gains strength, other cards reward you for forging alliances between factions — but no matter who you fight for, you'll find the cards you need at the Kingsmoot!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Tinz Herbalist
Description: Whether you're at a party, at the park or the beach, in a bar or a cafe or even just at home,Tinz is the perfect companion for 2 or more players. Games typically last 10-15 minutes so in bigger groups it's winner stays on. The system in Tinz is one of the most simple to learn and teach. Pick up a card and then play a card, if you have two matching cards then play the two. Once you play a card it is known as a sold card. You collect the sell value and the first player to reach 4,000G's is the winner, simple right? However everything changes because every single turn you also turn over an Action card. This is where the fun really starts! Will it be the cops busting you? A hydroponics upgrade for increased weed sell value, that sees players bidding against each other. Or the arrival of a rival gang that forces players to cooperate. Tinz Herbalist is pure fun in a tin!

Name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Trust in the Force
Description:
With its sixty new cards (including two copies each of five new objective sets), Trust in the Force pushes the Alliances cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game closer to its climactic conclusion. The Galactic Empire's AT-ATs and AT-STs trample across the galaxy. The Jedi have fallen. Alderaan has been destroyed. And the defenders of freedom hide themselves on distant planets, biding their time until they can mount a critical counterattack. Even as it brings new war machines and Jedi Masters to your games, Trust in the Force adds to the cycle's focus on decks with multiple affiliations.

—description from the publisher

Contains objective sets 280-284.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Star Wars – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Star Wars: Destiny – Boba Fett Starter Set
Description:
Track your targets across the galaxy with the Boba Fett Starter Set for Star Wars: Destiny.

The Boba Fett Starter Set features twenty-four new cards and nine premium dice, providing the perfect jumping on point for new players to Star Wars: Destiny.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Destiny – Luke Skywalker Starter Set
Description:
Save the galaxy with the Luke Skywalker Starter Set for Star Wars: Destiny.

The Luke Skywalker Starter Set features twenty-four new cards and nine premium dice to provide the perfect jumping on point for new players to Star Wars: Destiny.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Destiny – Legacies Booster Pack
Description:
Expand your Star Wars: Destiny collection with Legacies, a new set of booster packs for the collectible dice and card game!

Legacies continues the evolution of Star Wars: Destiny, expanding on classic archetypes while introducing new mechanisms, including a new die symbol and a new card type. As a new Base Set, Legacies is a solid starting point for Destiny newcomers while introducing innovative new concepts that challenge classic gameplay and tactics.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Destiny – Rivals Draft Set
Description:
Star Wars: Destiny – Rivals Draft Set is a twenty-card pack that introduces a whole new way to play Star Wars: Destiny in the form of draft and sealed events.

The Rivals Draft Set includes twenty cards that are meant to supplement cards drafted from Booster Packs. With characters, supports, upgrades, and events of every color, the Rivals Draft Set gives you all the tools you need to construct a successful deck. Every card featured in Rivals is legal for constructed play in Destiny and makes for a great way to expand your collection.
Playing in a draft requires each player to have one Rivals Draft Set and six booster packs of any set.

Name: The F'ing Truth
Description:
The F'ing Truth is a talking-about-sex game. Players are prompted by the cards to ask each other questions ("Have you ever had sex with a person on the same day you met them?") and tell each other stories ("Tell a story about something you feel confident about in sexual situations").

Each "yes" answer and story shared allows players to cross off a square on their f'board, until somebody gets a line of five crossed-off squares (you know, kind of like Bingo). That person is the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Flipper
Description: Children's dexterity game based on TV and movie dolphin Flipper. Each player gets ten hoops they try to send flying on a rotating board. Battery operated board spins, with player colored dolphins poking their noses up and down. Player with the most hits is the winner.

Name: Malifaux: Kamaitachi
Description:
A variety of myths surround this creature from Dust Devils to Wind Sickles; they take the form of weasels and generally do unpleasant things to people...

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Kamaitachi

Stat Cards

Kamaitachi

Name: Malifaux: Katanaka Snipers
Description:
When a bow simply doesn't cut it, the Ten Thunders turn to these ninjas. As the name suggests, these Ansatsu Sha are snipers employed by the Katanaka family to eliminate their rivals from afar.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing two 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

2 Katanaka Snipers

Stat Cards

2 Katanaka Snipers

Name: Malifaux: Komainu
Description:
Taking a more active role than their historical counterparts, these stone guardian statues, often taking the form of a dog, can be found defending Ten Thunders interests throughout Malifaux. Although they firmly believe that the best form of defense is a good offense, tearing apart the soul of anyone they deem a threat to their charges!

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing two 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

2 Komainu

Stat Cards

2 Komainu

Name: Malifaux: Lone Swordsman
Description:
I remember a story my father told me when I was a boy, before the annihilation of my clan.

There was once a man who had dishonored his family, and he swore to the Gods that he would go into the forest and slay the most ferocious beast he could find to bring them honor again. So the man did as he said, braving claw and fang to fell the largest, most feral thing he had ever laid eyes on. But, after he had completed his task, the man got lost in the forest.

Fearing the Gods were still angry, he slew beast after breast, each larger and more ferocious than the last, but nothing seemed to please the Gods.

Finally, the man forgot that he was a man at all and became a beast himself, lost in the forest.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Lone Swordsman

Stat Cards

Lone Swordsman

Name: Malifaux: Monks of Low River
Description:
Where the Ten Thunders originated from is a mystery to the residents of Malifaux. The crime family's origins within the Three Kingdoms back Earthside are shrouded in mystery, couched in legend, and sprinkled with lies. The Ten Thunders' membership is almost exclusively comprised of residents of the Three Kingdoms, any of whom would give their lives for the family rather than reveal its secrets - the Guild knows this from practice. Even the Ten Thunders' locally hired agents - of which there are few - do not know how their employers have been able to reach across the Breach, establishing an extensive crime network in the City.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Monks of Low River

Stat Cards

3 Monks of Low River

Name: Malifaux: Monks of High River
Description:
Acolytes of the oldest temple in the Five Rivers Valley, the monks of High River are also the most feared. Trained in a wide range of both agonizing and lethal combat skills, the monks are adept at violence and its application. Legends abound of individual monks facing down a dozen men, or turning the tide of a battle single handedly. They are seen by some as demons of pure rage; a reputation the monks use to their advantage, covering their faces with steel masks to conceal their humanity.

The monks of High River cannot be swayed to a cause with promises of power, wealth, or honor. They do not concern themselves with material rewards, only with the perfection of their art. That their chosen art is pain and death means they can be swayed with the promise of deadly opponents against which to hone their skills. Those who request the monks' assistance do so knowing they are unleashing living weapons onto their enemies, and must hope those enemies prove worthy of the monks' attentions.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Monks of High River

Stat Cards

3 Monks of High River

Name: Dead Sprint
Description:
Dead Sprint is a tile based board game for 2-5 players outrunning a horde of undead throughout the game while also avoiding/combating the undead in front of them. Players will utilize special items to help them along the way including: first aid kits to survive attacks, weapons to improve their attacks and action cards they can draw that changes up the strategy for every player.
â€‹
The game features special types of undead that will force the players to decide how to deal with them based on their inventory. The horde will consume any undead left behind to catch up to the players. The first person to find the exit or the last person to not die is the winner.

description from the designer

Name: Last Full Measure: The Battles of South Mountain
Description:
Last Full Measure is a series of free print-and-play games of battles of the American Civil War. South Mountain is the third game in the series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in under 10 pages of rules. Game files aids include Rules, Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and tables; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and with 480 counters.

The Battle Book includes four Scenarios; Fox's Gap, Turner's Gap, Crampton's Gap, a the full campaign of all three battles; an initial strength chart, and a terrain effects chart specific to South Mountain.

The map measures 30" x 48" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex and 100 feet per level of elevation with 480 counters.

The full game is available for download at: http://UhlanGames.us
as are Zun Tzu gameboxes for all LFM games

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Pioneers of Mars
Description:
Pioneers of Mars is a long term generational story of the arrival and advancement of industry and civilization on Martian soil.  You are the Commander, assigned to the Red Planet on behalf of a Terran Government or Corporation (who can tell anyways these days), in order to gain enough Prestige to ensure your place in the annals of history as the First President of Mars.

Game-Play consists of a 5x5 grid of Generational cards which allows for variable turn order each game.  Balancing the constraints of energy, life support, prestige and resource management, you must expand your own territories, colonists and prestige to allow for personalized work placement on your own Base, while still countering other players moves in the main game space through military actions.

Commanders are assigned 5 faction trait cards from the player deck, allowing for specialized strategies and providing additional replay value.

Prestige is gained or lost through a variety of personal base cards, generational space cards, and negative actions.  Grants are representative of permanent negative prestige points and are representative of the populaces negative view of your choices.

Name: Luftkampf
Description: There is only a game board and a piece of the box top.  This is a roll or spin and move along a track, meeting obstacles along the way.

Name: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Frost Man Promo Cards
Description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Frost Man is a new character  that is compatible with all other Pixel Tactics games.

This was a reward for backing Game Boy Geek - Season 5 (2017) on Kickstarter. 
Two copies of the card were included - one with a red back; the other with a blue back while the fronts are identical

Name: Dark.net
Description:
The tech-future which mankind has been working towards is finally upon us! Sadly, the tech-future is not all we thought it was cracked up to be; technology couldn't save us from ourselves, and there are no hoverboards or floating cars in sight. Contrary to our hopes and dreams, four mega-corporations dominate and dictate every aspect of our lives.

In Dark.net, players intercept transmissions to gain valuable information via their data network. Players use fences to buy and sell information so they can boost their ability to gather even more information, all in the service of acquiring reputation. To boost their reputation, players will accrue credits, extend their network, hire informants, install network boosters, and make contacts. Have more reputation than anyone else at game's end, and you win.

Name: Planet Infraserv
Description:
A promotional game from Infraserv Höchst. There is a game board depicting a central and eight outer planet, connected by paths. Players roll and move over the field, trying to reach the outer planets to collect one tile from each planet. On the way, players reach special fields where they can draw cards which speed up movement (or slows it down), or occasionally have other effects. Barricades can be used to block other players' ideal path. When a pawn steps on the same field as another pawn, it can steal a tile from that player. 
The first player to collect all eight different tiles is the winner.

Name: King's Forge: Hi-Energy Specs Craft Cards
Description:
From Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign:

Two new customized King's Forge craft cards by Game Salute. They use Dan's Glasses! The #77 version of this cards requires the King's Forge: Queen's Jubilee & King's Forge: Glassworks expansions.

Simply mix these cards into their respective craft decks and play as normal.

Note: The King's Forge: Gold expansion includes the #72 main deck version of these Hi-Energy Specs with the same illustration and crafting requirements, but renames them Alchemist's Spectacles.

These cards were later sold separately in the BGG Store.

Name: High Treason: The Trial of Louis Riel – Defense Testimony Promo Card
Description:
A single promo card from Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

Defense Testimony (4 actions)
Jury Selection: Reveal and peek at 1 Occupation

Name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – King Yaz Promo Card
Description:
A new customized free agent to add to the free agent deck for Baseball Highlights: 2045.

Simply shuffle it with the other free agents and proceed as normal

From Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

Name: Ancient Terrible Things: Madness of McGuffin
Description:
Ancient Terrible Things: Madness of McGuffin is a mini-expansion for the game Ancient Terrible Things, and includes 8 starting Swag cards (2 for each Explorer), a new Revelation Encounter, and quick reference rules card and backstory.

Combined with the white action dice, the Swag cards introduce a simplified re-roll and resource mechanic. The Revelation Encounter card utilises purple dice.

(White and purple dice are sold separately and available in Ancient Terrible Things: Skullpips accessory pack and in the game Konja).

—description from the publisher

Name: Covert: The King Character Card
Description:
From Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

A new character card that may be selected by a player

Text:
You have a permanent camera and film to use for completing missions

Name: Barbaou
Description:
Theme
The players have 5 minutes in order to win (there is a timer). Players are divers who try to defeat a giant monster: Barbaou.

Goal.
During the game, you will have to collect a maximum of cards. Be carefull, Barbaou will keep an eye on you. At the end of the game, all the cards collected by the players will give them points (set collection) and all the cards remaining on the board will give points to Barbaou. If you want to win, you must have more points than Barbaou.

Game-play
All the players are divers from the same team (cooperative game). During his turn, a player has to move (2 action points) and collect a card (animal or garbage). The board (35 cards : animals, waste, gyres, etc.) is quickly disappearing. All your actions will have consequences: if you collect an animal, Barbaou will get away from you. If you take some waste, Barbaou will get closer to you.

End of the game
The game will stop if the timer is finished, if one of the divers can't move or if Barbaou captures one of the divers. If you have more points than Barbaou, you win the game !

Name: Aquatico
Description:
As a nation with a vast aquatic ecosystem, Indonesia understands well the importance of educating its people to protect its aquatic ecosystem, both marine and fresh water.

Aquatico is designed to introduce the content of the aquatic ecosystem and the bio-diversity that dwells in it to its players. The gameplay is suitable for family with young children.

Name: Get Egg
Description:
HaPi, KuPi, JiPo, and IPo want to make strawberry cake, so they need to collect the main
ingredients of the cake: eggs as well as up to ten grains. When the eggs are collected, it turns out some eggs are cracked and cannot be used.

In Get Egg, help them collect good eggs to make delicious cakes.

Name: Perahu Buru-Buru
Description:
In the 14th century, there was an Admiral of Sulawesi who had four sons. The Admiral promised to give a gift of a newly built ship made at that time: the Phinisi Ship — but only to one of his sons.

To determine who will win the ship in Perahu Buru-Buru, the Admiral of the Bugis tribe challenged his sons to sail on the open seas by boat. The one who best manages to navigate the waters will win.

Name: Roket Raket
Description:
Playing as a rookie badminton player, you will have to manage both your stamina and skills to be able to win the game.

In Roket Raket, a player can pick the character suits them the most as the various characters have varied skill sets as well. Some of them are better at the long-rally game, some may excel in smash or back-smash.

Name: Buto Ijo dan Timun Mas
Description: We have only the Buto Ijo dan Timun Mas title at this time.

Name: Spello
Description:
"An exciting word game to improve spelling skills"

This is an educational board game for elementary school children. It is designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 players.

Three sets of cards (Letter, Spellbound, and Bonus) are placed face down and the players roll dice to move around the board. The contestant must then draw a card matching his or her current space on the board. Letter cards are relatively simple words while Bonus cards are more difficult to spell. Spellbound cards are simple vocabulary questions that also require proper spelling. A variable number of points are scored depending on the difficulty of the word.

Total points awarded are recorded on an erasable score card. A round ends when the card is filled up. A session may consist of multiple rounds.

Includes board, cards, pawns, dice, marker, and score chart. The rules are printed on the inside of the box lid.

Name: Mataram
Description: The Mataram board game revolves around the kingdom of Mataram, one of the ancient kingdoms that stood as the very foundation of Indonesia. Mataram is also known as one of the few countries in the old world that unites two major religions at the same time, with Syiwa Buddhism and Hindu living harmoniously and prospering. Temple of Borobudur and Temple of Prambanan were only a few samples of the Mataram golden era.

Name: Uptime
Description:
In the dystopian future era of Uptime, a struggle for power means struggle for information. The five factions on this time battle each other to dominate access to the data network. The one who gets "uptime" by connecting their transceiver tower to the satellites will take control over the world.

Can you do that?

Name: Munchkin Shakespeare: Staged Demo
Description:
All the World's a Stage for Your Munchkin Demo!
Do you have friends who love Shakespeare but have never tried Munchkin? Sure, you do! Use the 17 cards in this booster, taken from Munchkin Shakespeare Deluxe with alternate art from comic illustrator Lar deSouza, to set up a short demo to introduce friends (or foes!) to the wacky world of Munchkin.

This is an expansion for Munchkin Shakespeare. It is not a stand-alone game. This is NOT a collectible or randomized set. Every Staged Demo pack is the same as every other.

Name: Count Leery
Description:
You want to collect as few cards as possible in Count Leery, but the rules for what to do when a cards appears will differ each game, so practice won't always make perfect.

Before the game begins, decide which rule cards to use for how to indicate numbers in the game: speaking in Japanese or English, using your fingers, clapping, etc. Lay these rule cards out, then reveal colored cards from the deck until each rule has two colored cards associated with it.

On a turn, reveal the top card of the deck, then indicate its number quickly in the proper way depending on the color of the card. If you do so, the next player immediately goes; if not, then you collect the card and all other face-up cards in the pile as well as a small amount of shame. Alternatively, when the cat card is revealed, everyone must race to place their hand on the deck, and whoever is slowest takes the pile of face-up cards.

Once the deck runs out — and you use only half the deck each game to keep some mystery as to which cards await — whoever has collected the fewest cards wins.

Name: MatematiKart
Description:
Welcome to the MatematiKart Tournament !!
Every year, the fastest animals in the world get together for a karting race. The Cheetah, the Gazelle, the Coyote and the Hare employ all of the irwit, intelligence and agility trying to be come the champion this year so they take home the fabled Best Driver Cup. Who might be this year’s winner?

In this game children compete in a race where they will have to apply their sum skills.
Every turn they will:

     Select 2 dice (there are 2D6, 2D10, 2D20)
     Throw them and sum/subtract the results
     Use special cards if they wish (they allow to turn , +/- movement, attack with coconuts, place bananas on the way)
     Move their car, trying not to crash


The game has 3 levels of difficulty:
Level 1: for children that count with one hand.
Level 2: For children that count with both hands
Level 3: For children that count with 2 digit numbers

This didactic material allow students to develop:
– The ability to mentally perform ADDITIONS and SUBTRACTIONS between numbers with one or two ciphers.
– Logical thinking
– The ability to evaluate risks.
– Strategic thinking.

COMPONENTS
1 RaceTrackBoard
27 ItemCards
4 Kart Tokens
8 Banana Tokens
1 ProximityRuler
1 ResultsSheet
1 Rulebook

MatematiKart is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way.
Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows forengaging and entertaininglearning.

Name: The Tricky Turtles
Description:
Once upon a time, there were two very tricky turtles who organized a great race to find out which of the two was the fastest, but how to make a good competition if both do not stop cheating? The PROBABILITIES may be on your side.

This game can be use in 2 ways:

A) INTERACTIVE STORY
The objective of the interactive story is to introduce the child to the concept of PROBABILITY. Reading the story and completing all of the activities included on it is mandatory before moving onto the TWO TURTLES RACE. This is required in order for the child to get acquainted with probabilities, and therefore is capable of making decisions based on them. We recommend that the parents or teacher of the child guides them during the reading of the story and the activities included in it.

B) TWO TURTLES RACE (this is the game):
This is a game in which only two participants will use practically the concepts learnt in the interactive story. They will develop their abilities of decision making based on probabilities, logical thinking, resource management, and strategic thinking.

There are 3 kind of dice in the game:
a)  3 faces in each of the 2 colors
b) 2 faces of one color and 4 of the other
c) all faces of one color

In a turn the kid is allow to roll an “a” dice, and he must advance the turtle of the corresponding color. But he is also allowed to spend coins to buy a b or c dice, which is used and returned. 
They gain more coins by stepping in some spaces of the track.
The firs turtle to cross the finish line is the winner.

COMPONENTS
• 1 storybook.
• 3 trackboardpieces.
• 1 finish line boardpiece.
• 5 dice 
• 2 turtle tokens.
• 12 turtlecoins.
• 2 “cheatsheet”.
• manual.
THIS DIDACTIC MATERIAL ALLOWS STUDENTS TO DEVELOP:
• Making decisions based on probabilities
• Logical Thinking
• Resource management
• Strategic Thinking.
Probabilities are a topic that is present in our everyday lives, and which is very importantwhen it comes to making decisions. However, it is very common that children have difficulty grasping the concept when it is introduced in school.
Tricky Turtles explains in simple and accessible terms what probabilities are, and it gives children the opportunity of experimenting with them in a fun and practical way.
Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which makes it a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

ABOUT LANGLEY
This game is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way. Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows forengaging and entertaininglearning.

Name: Treasure Times!!
Description:
The pirate crew has split: everyone wants to be the first to find the Treasures of the evil Captain Barbasucia. Will you be able to become the richest Pirate of the Seven Seas?

This game has 2 steps. 
Step one: Kids take turns taking a treasure card from the deck, which features a multiplication on the back, and the result on the pother face. The kid must read the multiplication out loud and say the result. If correct the card is placed on the board where there is a space for each result.

Step 2: Once all cards in play are on the board (it is possible to decide which tables will be on the game) the game begins. Kids will take turns discovering treasures. That means they must point at a treasure card and mention a multiplication that will allow that result. If correct the kid collects the card. The player with most cards wins.

LEARN THE MULTIPLICATION TABLES IN AN EFFECTIVE AND FUN WAY!
Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which makes it a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.
There is no way to solve multiplications more efficiently and easily than through the memorization of tables. Because of this, learning said multiplication tables is a milestone in every student’s learning process. It becomes a basic and necessary tool to solve different kinds of everyday problems, and it is the basis upon which other more complex mathematical skills are built, such as divisions, fractions, and proportions. 
The main objective of this material is to help the student memorize the multiplication tables in an efficient and fun way. However, the student should be introduced to the concept of multiplication before beginning the exercises concerning tables. All concepts related to multiplication can be studied at the Langley Math Learning Centers.

COMPONENTS
• 1 Island game board.
• 8 map card with multiplication tables from two to nine.
• 80 treasure tiles (ten per each multiplication table from two to nine).
• 80 Map Fragment cards (ten per each multiplication table from two to nine).
• 1 Hourglass.
• This manual.
This didactic material allows students to develop:
• Mastery of the multiplication tables from two to nine.
• Memorization skills.
• Focus and Concentration.
• The ability to work under pressure.

ABOUT LANGLEY
This game is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way. Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

Name: Cuncuna Friends 1
Description:
THE CUNCUNA FRIENDS 1 teaches numbers 1 to 50

“CUNCUNA” means caterpillar. It is a word that comes from Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, one of the biggest native South American peoples in Chile. Cuncuna Friends is about a group of very friendly and playful cuncunas. Each one is very different, but they all are eager to meet you and play with you! 
Cuncuna Friend Includes more than seven different game modes
The game comes with 50 plastic pieces which allows kids to 1-5 caterpillar. There are 5 color of pieces (1-10/11-20/21-30/31-40/41-50).  Children can just play with the pieces trying to place them in numerical order, or they can play one of the games.

A game description:
Each player is deal 5 pieces at the beginning of the game. On their turn they must pick a new piece from a bag, and if it can form a secuence with one of the pieces he has he can put them together and place it in the middle of the table. They can also try to match a piece with one that’s in the table.
The first kid to get rid of all their pieces win.
This games teaches: Numerical Sequence 1 – 50, Successor and predecessor, Patterns, Logical thinking

COMPONENTS
•    25 plastic double links ( divided in five colored groups, with 5 pieces in each group)
•    30 circular nodes (in five different colors, 6 units per color)
•    5 cuncuna brochures
•    One small canvas bag
•    This rulebook

ABOUT LANGLEY
CUNCUNA FRIENDS can be used to carry out a wide variety of different didactic activities, depending on the needs of each student, the amount of participants, and the specific pedagogic objectives of the teacher. Detailed descriptions of possible activities are included in this document, so as to give the tutors in charge of the game tools to address the needs of their particular group. However, once the participants have become acquainted with the material and the activities available, it is encouraged that they are allowed to choose themselves what tasks to carry out, or even create their own.
Since one of the fundamental pillars of the Langley Math Learning System is self-learning, the teacher or tutor must only act as a facilitator, choosing the most appropriate task considering their skills and needs, explaining it and giving examples if required. The students must be protagonist of their own learning process at all times, and they must have the opportunity to identify their own mistakes and self-correct. To carry out all tasks, this product includes supporting material which must be available should they need them.

This game is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way. Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

Name: Cuncuna Friends 2
Description:
THE CUNCUNA FRIENDS 1 teaches numbers 51 to 100

“CUNCUNA” means caterpillar. It is a word that comes from Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, one of the biggest native South American peoples in Chile. Cuncuna Friends is about a group of very friendly and playful cuncunas. Each one is very different, but they all are eager to meet you and play with you!

Cuncuna Friend Includes more than seven different game modes
The game comes with 50 plastic pieces which allows kids to 1-5 caterpillar. There are 5 color of pieces (51-60 / 61-70 / 71-80 / 81-90 / 91-100).  Children can just play with the pieces trying to place them in numerical order, or they can play one of the games.

A game description:
Each player is deal 5 pieces at the beginning of the game. On their turn they must pick a new piece from a bag, and if it can form a secuence with one of the pieces he has he can put them together and place it in the middle of the table. They can also try to match a piece with one that’s in the table.
The first kid to get rid of all their pieces win.
This games teaches: Numerical Sequence 51 - 100, Successor and predecessor, Patterns, Logical thinking

COMPONENTS
•    25 plastic double links ( divided in five colored groups, with 5 pieces in each group)
•    30 circular nodes (in five different colors, 6 units per color)
•    5 cuncuna brochures
•    One small canvas bag
•    This rulebook

ABOUT LANGLEY
CUNCUNA FRIENDS can be used to carry out a wide variety of different didactic activities, depending on the needs of each student, the amount of participants, and the specific pedagogic objectives of the teacher. Detailed descriptions of possible activities are included in this document, so as to give the tutors in charge of the game tools to address the needs of their particular group. However, once the participants have become acquainted with the material and the activities available, it is encouraged that they are allowed to choose themselves what tasks to carry out, or even create their own.
Since one of the fundamental pillars of the Langley Math Learning System is self-learning, the teacher or tutor must only act as a facilitator, choosing the most appropriate task considering their skills and needs, explaining it and giving examples if required. The students must be protagonist of their own learning process at all times, and they must have the opportunity to identify their own mistakes and self-correct. To carry out all tasks, this product includes supporting material which must be available should they need them.

This game is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way. Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

Name: Plan 9 from Outer Space: The Deckbuilding Game
Description:
You and up to 3 of your friends will have to utilize your stupid (STUPID!) minds to battle flying saucers over Hollywood who have resurrected a trio of ghouls in this deck building game based on Edward D. Wood Jr.'s infamous "Plan 9 from Outer Space"!

"Plan 9 from Outer Space: The Deckbuilding Game" is a co-operative deck builder for 1 to 4 players that lovingly adapts "the worst movie of all time" into the card game it was never meant to be!

Players must acquire cards featuring the film's heroes -- to battle the invading aliens who are bent on the destruction of humanity! Fight their trio of bizarre ghoul soldiers -- Inspector Clay, Vampira, and a guy who looks like Dracula -- but also kind of like a dentist in multiple locations from the film.

Players must defeat the alien onslaught before time runs out and they destroy humanity!

Name: Shadows Over Normandie: Cthulhu Mythos Call #2
Description:
With this expansion, you will find the cards,Order tokens and dice you need to play a new faction,the Mythos one. Play as the bad guys,play those who have sold their souls to the evil forces that threaten our world,those whose mental health falters or has already completely collapsed. Be bad!

You must have the Shadows over Normandie base game in order to use this expansion Pack.

Content:

1 punchboard: Luc Lo Pan, the Green Rascal
1 50-Action cards deck for playing the Mythos
1 Order token set for Mythos
2 Mythos dice
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Figura
Description:
A tile-placing game with hidden goals and a shared tile pool.

34 goal cards
24 hexagonal tiles (12 black & 12 white)

Both players add tiles to a shared playing surface trying of create their goal shape using both white and black tiles.  The goal cards can be rotated to match the direction that the tiles are placed.

When the shared tile pool runs out tiles from the exterior edge can be moved to new positions.

The winner is the first person to create the image on their goal card.

Name: Shadows over Normandie: New Characters
Description:
Exclusive punchboard from the Kickstarter #3 Strategic Resupply

Came with the SoN storage solution.

Three new characters for SoN + tokens ( 16 )

Oliver Derwetho - special investigator

Jenarth' - Dagon's favorite

Dark Fire - Black Sun experimental fire soldier

Those 3 new characters were
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: The Art of Batik
Description:
Welcome to a Batik workshop in Surakarta, Indonesia in the late 1970s. You and your friends play the role of assistants to Mbok Mase (a woman who manage Batik Workshop). As a good assistant, you must manage the workers to make a beautifully crafted Batik with the right skills and ingredients. Now, can you prove your management skill to your Mbok Mase and be thrived among other assistants?

The objective of The Art of Batik is to complete each process of Batik cards so that it can be sent to the customers. At their turn, player has option either to draw an ingredient card or to fill in the spot on a Batik process card with talented worker and ingredients. Then when a Batik card is finished, each player who participate in finishing that Batik will get a various rewards based on their amount of participation. When five Batik cards has been finished, the game end immediately and the player with the most victory points will be named as the best assistant.

Name: Acaraki: The Java Herbalist
Description:
The Book of Madhawapura tells about the story of Acaraki, a herbalist or an expert of concocting Jamu. "Jamu" is a Javanese word which employs meaning of a mixture of natural herb ingredients that have been existed since centuries ago.

In Acaraki: The Java Herbalist, players will act as the apprentice of Ra Tanca, the greatest Acaraki in Majapahit Empire. As the apprentices of Ra Tanca, they had to race to collect the herb ingredients and concocted them into Jamu to cure the diseases suffered by people in five regions of Majapahit. Race to determine who’d deserve the coveted position of Ra Tanca as the next best Acaraki in Majapahit!

On each turn, the player has four actions to be done. Those actions are looking for ingredients (drawing a card), move from one village to another, cure a patient in the village, or using an Ajian. The goal of the game is to cure as many villagers as possible. And the game ends when one village has no sick villager.

Name: Ofmos Classic
Description: Ofmos is a family of business games.

Name: Detective: City of Angels – Bullets over Hollywood
Description:
This expansion for the narrative board game Detective: City of Angels includes 4 all-new Cases, 200 Cards to expand your investigative gameplay.

Contents include: 4 Detective Casebooks, Chisel Casebook, Sleuth (Solo) Casebook, 12 Suspect Standees, 4 Case Tuckboxes, 77 Case & Mystery & Other Cards, 35 Response Cards, 97 Search & Special Cards, 4 Sleuth (Solo) Cards
Families: Game: Detective – City of Angels (Van Ryder Games)

Name: Dice Hospital: Deluxe Add-Ons Box
Description:
The deluxe add-ons include five 3D ambulances, the experimental medicine mini expansion pack, wooden tokens for the blood bags and fatality tokens, and a build your own hospital-themed dice tower!

The experimental medicine mini expansion pack offers a new style of upgrade tiles and specialists. While retaining the euro-style control of the base game dice manipulation, the expansion offers an alternative way to manipulate tiles. Essentially the tiles and specialists upgrades may change the value of the dice by going down a step (clinical trials), re-rolling dice (experimental drugs), and swapping values (transplants). This gives a much more versatile feel to the game and actually introduces really interesting levels of strategy that even we find to be novel each time we play it when combo'd with tiles/specialists from the base game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Karnivore Koala: Insects Expansion
Description:
The hunt for mutated insects has begun and this expansion offers you 18 new mutant animal, 16 new workbear, and 5 new Koala King cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Near and Far: Handy Headwear Promo Pack
Description: A promotional pack of five new artifact cards, first offered with the Amber Mine Kickstarter project.

Name: The Colonists: Ante Portas
Description:
Die Kolonisten: Ante Portas, a new scenario for Tim Puls' epic strategy game The Colonists, introduces new combat mechanisms that allow players to compete against the game, or directly against each other.

Die Kolonisten: Ante Portas adds two areas in addition to your own colony and the "home country": the battlefield and the command center. On the battlefield, the actual battle takes place, while the command center forms a new area, which is constructed from hexes like the coreland. You enter this area in the usual way by jumping onto its market. Here are the actions necessary to win your battles. You can build structures, construct traps, mines and bombs, as well as hiring your farmers and citizens and train them to be soldiers. Also, it is possible to heal your soldiers after battle.

Die Kolonisten: Ante Portas offers the opportunity for one to three players to go up against the game or for two or four players to fight in "1 against 1" or "2 against 2" mode.  The new mechanisms also offer a much higher player interaction, as desired by many players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Sacrificio
Description:
Sacrifice Sacrificio is a turn- based strategy game of 2 to 4 players in which your spiritual and strategy skills will be tested as  maximum priest. You will have to obtain the greatest number of human hearts to win the favor of gods and bring prosperity to your town personifying the maximum Maya priest.

You will in charge of three temples, where you will must go placing the corresponding priests.  At the center will be located the victim, who is going to be sacrified by the dagger of the same color  as temple to obtain his/her heart. As top priests, you can curse temples, sending eclipses or invoking our god Kukulcan to help us to complete our ritual of sacrifice and handicap our opponents.

The game is not language dependent - The board game can be downloaded for free here.

Sacrificio es un juego de 2 a 4 jugadores donde se pondrán a prueba tus habilidades espirituales y de estrategia como máximo sacerdote. Tendrás que obtener el mayor número de corazones humanos para ganar el favor de los dioses y llenar a tu pueblo de prosperidad.

Es un juego de estrategia por turnos donde personificas a un máximo sacerdote Maya. Estas a cargo de tres templos en los cuales, turno a turno, debes ir colocando sacerdotes según corresponda. En el centro de ellos deberá ir una víctima, la cual sacrificaras para obtener su corazón. Como máximo sacerdote podrás maldecir templos, enviar eclipses o invocar al dios Kukulkán para que te ayude a completar el ritual de sacrificio y a perjudicar a tus oponentes.

El juego no tiene dependencia del idioma - El tablero de juego puede descargarse gratis acá.

—description from the publisher

Name: Killing Code: Venice Vendetta – Dead End Bridge
Description:
Promo card for Killing Code: Venice Vendetta.

This card allows the player acting as the Killer use one more killing method to murder the target.

Name: Line: The Skateboard Game
Description:
In Line you are a professional skateboarder competing against your opponents to take the grand prize. Lay down the best tricks and sickest combos to increase your score, but make sure your tricks link together or you may bail and break your flow.

Line is a card-laying game for 2-4 players based around combining cards for the highest score. Players draft for cards and place them in their Line, ensuring that the trick connects to both the current obstacle and their previous trick. Points are scored based on length of combos so clever trick choice is vital to make the winning Line.

—description from the designer

Name: Brawlers
Description:
Brawlers is a two player game played in a mint tin. It's quick, silly, easy to learn and surprisingly challenging. Single-player rules are also included to help you learn the skills needed to win.

A rowdy and mischievous game that children of all ages will be able to enjoy.
Quarrel with your friends with a gang of nine tough goons each. Sneak past the angry police man and be the last man standing.
Learn to use your wits and cunning, whilst gaining a steady hand at he same time. But Brawlers is not just educational, it is also quite enjoyable indeed!

The notorious British street gangs of the posh Pips and the blusterous Rousters have been at it for years. Vying for dominance in the smuggling trade, their rivalry has presently come to a pinnacle.
Nine each of their finest pugilists gather upon an east London wharf to settle their grievances at last.
A lone bobby stands betwixt the rival bands, attempting to bar their path. The striving gangs will quarrel until one of them is thoroughly & truly defeated with none left standing.

—description from the publisher

Name: DrunkQuest: Porcelain Gods
Description:
DrunkQuest: Porcelain Gods is the second expansion to the best drinking game ever made. For years we've heard people tell us things like "I don't drink but my friends do, or, "I'm always the Designated Driver." If that sounds familiar this expansion was built specifically for you!

In Porcelain Gods, the DD takes up the role of a Deity in the world of DrunkQuest. Smiting players who refuse to bend to their will while blessing the players that do. All the while changing the atmosphere of the game and adding entertaining and challenging new rules. So lets see what these Deities are capable of!

In this expansion one player takes the role of the Deity, whose objective is to unleash 3 Wrath cards and battle (and win) the players in one epic final fight. The game flow follows the rules of the main game, aside from the fact that the boss is swapped with the Deity, and the Deity player himself has some Intervention cards that allow him to enjoy the game without drinking.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hibernation
Description:
Overview:
A fun, fast paced & easy to learn game. Take the role of a bear waking from hibernation, slim & hungry. It's time to prepare for next year's big sleep. Alas, other bears in your ecosystem have become extremely competitive. Race to gather food while fending off foes along the way. To do this you will forage, frenzy, and even steal to stockpile your hoard. Better get going, winter will come fast.

Goal:
Hibernation is a bear themed Deck building card game. Your Deck contains your means of finding FOOD. It starts out forlorn and bare, but you strive to make it a perfect library of FOOD collecting assets.
Then, eat your FOOD in proper portions to gain layers of fat. The first one to achieve the 5 required layers of fat via Hibernation tokens can rest easy - victorious!

Turn Progress:
Each turn, players may choose 1 of 4 OPTIONS:
(REST, PURCHASE A CARD, DRAW A CARD or EAT)

REST:
Add 5 to your ENERGY total.
or
Add 3 to your ENERGY total, and every player must shuffle their Discard Pile into their Deck at the end of the turn.

PURCHASE A CARD:
Spend a portion of your ENERGY to add a FORAGE card to your Deck. Then, shuffle your Deck.

DRAW A CARD:
Draw a card from the top of your Deck and play it. Some cards will allow you to add FOOD to your Hoard, while others have special abilities.

EAT:
Return FOOD cards from your Hoard to the bottom of their respective piles and collect a Hibernation token. This can only be done when you have a combination of FOOD cards whose value equals 10.

Includes: 
68 - Cards 
1 - Fold-Out Rule Sheet 
All contained in a compact, easy to travel with, tuck box.

Name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Home Cookin' Expansion
Description: 15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck. This expansion adds new Immediate Actions for the Home Team as well as for Extra Innings.

Name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Double Trouble Expansion
Description: 15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck.  This expansion does not provide any new Immediate Actions. However, it does introduce cards with two Immediate Actions. These cards are more flexible, but generally have stricter conditions for them to take effect. Some cards will not be able to be played for both effects.

Name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Ballparks Expansion
Description:
The Ballparks Expansion adds 10 cards that provide a new game mechanic, Home Ballpark.

When playing with Ballparks, each player is dealt two random ballpark cards and selects one for their home ballpark. The other card is discarded face down. Whenever a player has the Home Field, the effect of their home ballpark applies. Ballpark effects apply to both players.

Name: The Shared Dream: The Crux Collection
Description: The Crux Collection adds 6 unique solo scenarios, each of which will help immerse you in the lore of The Shared Dream.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: The Shared Dream: Night Terrors
Description:
When a vicious Blood Drinker savagely hunts throughout the city, only the curse of the Moon Beast can stop it! Every night phase, players gain a chance to become the vicious Moon Beast, the only force strong enough to directly confront the Blood Drinker.

The Blood Drinker and Moon Beast can also be used as new characters to play any Shared Dream Scenario.

Darker still is the inclusion of a new Reaver type, the Malefic. Created by an abundance of Shadows, the Malefic floods the city with enemies, requiring everyone to handle the new threat.

The Malefic can be used to greatly increase the challenge of any Shared Dream scenario.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: The Shared Dream: Necrophobia
Description: The Shared Dream's take on the zombie genre! When there's no more room in your head, the dead will walk the earth! Featuring a brand new Nemesis, the Necromancer, Necrophobia sees players deal with an onslaught of undead enemies guided by a dark sorcerer's hand.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: The Shared Dream: Wrath of Axitath
Description: The Horned Horror of Laruna lays waste to the Waking World in the Wrath of Axitath! This add-on introduces the new "Wrath of Axitath" scenario to The Shared Dream and includes the 85mm tall Axitath miniature!
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: The Shared Dream: Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack for The Shared Dream was obtainable during its Kickstarter campaign. It contains The Descendant and and The Red Beast miniatures as well as alternate promo characters.

Taken from the KS Update #3:

The Promo Pack Includes:
- 2 new miniatures: The Descendant and the Red Beast
- 1 new playable character (Uriah/The Descendant)
- 6 Alternate Animus that can be combined with existing Waking World characters to increase replayability
- New Nightclub location
- 2 New Artifacts
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: The Shipwreck Arcana: Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack contains ten more cards for The Shipwreck Arcana:
The Passage
The Pallbearers
The Wish
The Ghost
Asunder
The Feast
Fortune
The Captain
Iron
The Lantern

Name: Guild Ball: Season 3 Plot Card Deck
Description: Guild Ball isn’t just a sport, but a political arena in which the guilds fight for influence. Players are often given special instructions before a game, their actions preventing the seizing of power and settling old grudges. The Guild Ball Plot Cards provide a representation of this intrigue in the game, an unexpected card foiling even the best laid plans.

Name: Death By Cantaloupe
Description:
Death by Cantaloupe
Ideal for 2-4 players.

Goal: Be the first player to reach exactly 100 points using any combination fruits/points

Card Types: (1) PENALTY cards are the Cantaloupe cards and MUST be cleared by penalized player before putting down points towards goal (2) Crazy Coconut cards can wipe out penalty cards immediately (3) Fruit cards each have point values of 5, 10, and 15 and are used to reach the 100-point goal or clear a penalty card
To Start: Shuffle all cards.  Deal each player 6 cards and put the remaining cards face down in a draw pile. EACH PLAYER WILL ALWAYS KEEP 6 CARDS IN THEIR HAND.

Game Play: Player 1 draws a card and makes a decision to either (1) put down a point card face up to add towards the 100-point goal OR (2) put down a PENALTY Death by Cantaloupe card on another player OR (3) discard and play nothing. Player 1 will still have 6 cards in hand when turn is over and it is the next player’s turn to draw a card and play.  At the end of each turn, the player will always have 6 cards in their hand.  The first player to have EXACTLY 100-points face up in front of them wins.  If the draw pile runs out, shuffle the discard pile and turn over to start a new draw pile.

Exception to Drawing a Card: If a player has a PENALTY Death by Cantaloupe card played on them, the combination of fruit cards MUST be placed down (one turn at a time) to clear the penalty.  The fruit combination can be from the player’s hand of cards or from their existing points pile (therefore reducing their point total).  IF A FRUIT CARD IS MOVED FROM THE FACE UP POINT TOTAL IN FRONT OF A PLAYER, THEY DO NOT DRAW A CARD AND THEIR TURN IS OVER.  The player still has 6 cards in their hand.
Death by Cantaloupe PENALTY: There are 6 penalty cards that have 2-fruit combinations and 6 penalty cards that have 3-fruit combinations.  Penalty cards must be face up with each card that clears it next to it.  When the penalty is cleared all cards go into the discard pile.  Only 1 card per turn can be played and NO point cards toward the 100-point goal can be played by the penalized player until the penalty is cleared.
Crazy Coconut: The Crazy Coconut instantly wipes out a penalty cantaloupe card.  The Death by Cantaloupe card and the Crazy Coconut cards (and any point cards already put down towards the penalty) go into the discard pile.  The player will still have 6 cards in their hand when turn is over.

Name: AssassinCon: Dan King Promo Pack
Description:
Contents:
12 movement cards
1 target card
1 assassin pawn with stand

Remove all orange cards from the base game and replace with these Dan King promo cards. Play as normal.
—description from Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

Name: Champions of Midgard: Draudan and Bergrisar King Promo Cards
Description:
Includes 4 cards:
Draudan x1
Bergrisar King x3 (3 different colors)

Shuffle into their respective decks and play as normal.

—description from Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

Name: Golem Arcana: Gudanna – Sun Viper
Description:
Elite unit for the Arcanum Gudanna Sand Viper

Dodge: 15
Armor: 6
Hit Points: 70
Movement Abilities:
Walk (1AP): 4 mp

Attack Abilities:
Burning Lash (1AP): 85 acc, 25 dmg, melee. If a Golem is in a Region that activates its passive, the Target is moved to an adjacent Region. This does not affect Colossi.
Solar Flare (2AP): 75 acc, 25 dmg, 1 rng. If this Golem is in a Region that activates its passive, this attack deals an extra 10 Damage and costs 1 less AP to use.

Passive Abilities:
Bask in Light: If this Golem is in a Control Region, or a Region that has had a Mana Well, it always gains 15 Dodge.

Name: Pixel Tactics: 2012-2017 Promo Pack
Description:
From Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

48 cards for Pixel Tactics includes some previously released cards as well as new ones.

The cards feature characters from popular board games, game designers, publishers, and other notables from the industry

Name: Defend Neo Tokyo
Description:
You’re at the controls of a six-story combat Mech! But will it be enough to save Neo Tokyo from the giant Monsters?

In this cooperative board game for up to five players, you build a Mech out of unique parts to create a deadly combat machine! Then take the controls and head into Neo Tokyo to battle Giant Monsters – but watch out for the citizens caught in the crossfire.

Featuring five-player cooperative battles, you and your friends will work to create the most effective Mechs you can from the parts you have on hand, then defend Neo Tokyo from the gigantic horrors that attack it. If you can work together with your teammates, choose the best strategy, and effectively manage your Mech’s power supply and repairs, Neo Tokyo may just survive. If you can’t, then it’s Game Over, man.

---------Game Overview-----------
Players build their Mechs using the three types of parts (Chassis, Arms, Legs).  Each part has a Tile and a set of cards associated with it. The tiles are combined to form the Mech while the cards are assembled to form the player's Command Deck.
Several Monsters are then placed onto the board which represents the city of Neo Tokyo. Citizen cards are also added to the city, and represent the people in Neo Tokyo that the players must defend.
The Monsters then attack, using an Event Deck which indicates which of the two attacked printed on the Monster Stat cards the Monster will resolve. If the Monster in alone in its City Space, it generally attacks the Citizens and the City itself. If there is a Mech in the space with it, a Monster will attack the Mech instead. This is important because when the Monsters destroy a City space or enough Citizens, the destruction track is raised. If the Destruction Track reaches the final space, the players lose the game!
After the Monsters attack, the players will then use their Command Cards or Tile Actions to engage the Monsters, usually generating a random amount of damage that is applied to the Monster.  Each attack raises a Monster Attack Track, which triggers another Monster Attack Phase when filled. 
Once the Monsters are all defeated, the Boss Monster appears. This is a bigger and tougher Monster that the players must defeat in order to win.  
If they can do this before the Destruction Track is filled, they successfully Defend Neo Tokyo

Name: DAR: Divide And Rule
Description:
Theme : strategic abstract game

Gameplay : Each player chooses a color of jewels. In his turn, the player use the sticks to create 4 territories on the board. He can put a crystal on each territory if he has a majority or equal statut with each player individually.
It's important to place them well to take the control of the most zones.

Goal : to have the most number of points at the end of the game. The player who has the most number of crystals
 in a zone gets  3 points. The second get 1 points.
The game ends when all the zones has its winner.

Name: Соображарий: Два!! (Think it Up Two!!)
Description:
The continuation of well-known party hit.

How many professions starting with the letter "M" can you name in a minute? Who can come up with the longest first name starting with "U"? Who can call the shortest drink starting with "R"? Who will be the first to name a thing that is cheaper than two dollars or an object that can be found only in the countryside...starting with "Z"? Think faster, or else your opponents will get ahead of you.

Think It Up! is a game for parties and family get-togethers. Each turn you draw letter and category cards, then show your great skills of reaction, trying to be the first player to come up with the right word. You do not have to be the know-it-all to win — you just have to be the fastest thinker!

Name: The Island PIZZA
Description:
The aim of the game is to collect the first one pizza of any color of the 6 pieces.

The cards represent pieces of pizza from 3 pairs of different types and 3 different colors (red, green, yellow), on some cards there are Hero-cards (Pepper, Mushroom, Knife and Fork), which has useful effects.

Think it's easy? It was not there, because in the game you'll not only find repeated pieces, discarding the wrong color, but also strongly interfere with favorite neighbors, using the effects of the Hero-cards. You can choose from and sharing bits and reset of the selected card and diabolical plans rigging the deck! Yes! We legalized cheating a little ))) Here is an adventure!

For those who are and it will seem easy, we have prepared Advanced Rules. The game adds a Ship-Captain special card and achievements!

Now 3 cards will always be open to players that provides an opportunity not only rely on luck and memory, but also to plan their actions! Special cards and achievements offer a real challenge - not just to win the game, but also to fulfill some conditions!

We thought about the smallest! For them there are Easy Rules, and card-tip and full-sized Pattern-hint (on the back of the Rules)

You can play with children from 5 years for Easy Rules and from 7 and 10 years for Basic and Advance Rules. The party lasts 10-20 minutes.

Name: Batte Bugs: Samurai
Description:
Description of the game:
As a player receives equal and opposing army of insects, consisting of 6 groups - each with its own characteristics.
Behind the screens, with the help of special tablets, players give orders to their armies or units, which are then executed simultaneously.Orders are actions by putting some counters on tablets, where you select a specific unit, as well as the direction and distance of its movement.

The basis of the game: stealth tactics with simultaneous progress on the playing field.

The goal - to implement a first one of the following purposes:
-The destruction of the enemy General;
-The destruction of the entire enemy army, except the General;
-The accumulation of 8 points of influence for the retention of the Central field of the cell.

1 box duel
2 boxes - up to 4 players!

Name: Qwixx: Characters
Description: Qwixx: Characters is a mini-expansion for Qwixx that consists of five character tiles, each with a special power. Maybe you'll get to change a missed turn into a marked space, or go back and fill a missed space, or use the white die twice.

Name: Stone Age: The Mammoth Herd
Description:
A mammoth herd is passing by close to your village. You can tame these mammoths in order to have their help when constructing your village. But hurry up! Other tribes are on their way as well!

You can combine this mini expansion with the basic game as well as with all other expansions. First, you set up the game as usual. You shuffle all 16 bonus tiles and place them face down next to the game board. The stand-up figure Mammoth herd is placed next to the pile. You are now ready to start the game. The game play stays the same except for the following changes.

At the beginning of each round, the start player places the mammoth herd on the resource shown by the top-most bonus tile. For example, if the tile shows a brick, the start player puts the mammoth herd into the clay pit. Then, he/she picks the first bonus tile and places it face up next to the pile. (The resource that is now shown is of no importance in this round.) If there are no bonus tiles left, the whole herd is tamed. In this case, you remove the mammoth herd and continue playing according to the normal rules. You place your people as usual. Only in the phase in which you use the actions of your people figures, the mammoth herd becomes important. When you have people placed on the resource on which the mammoth herd stays, you roll the dice as usual and take your resources. Immediately after this, you may move one or more people from the resource where the mammoth herd is placed to the bonus tile that was turned over. With these people figures, you can try to tame a mammoth later in order to have help for your work. You are only allowed to move people figures from this resource production area, and you immediately have to pay 1 food for each people figure you place on the bonus tile. You may - as it is the case for feeding - substitute 1 food with 1 resource. People figures that are not placed on the bonus tile must be taken back to the player board. After all players have used the actions of their people, but before the feeding, you tame 1 mammoth from the mammoth herd.

All players who moved people to the bonus tile roll the dice. Each player uses as many dice as he has people on the bonus tile. All players roll the dice at the same time. Now, you compare the score of your highest single die. (You do not add all dice together as usual, and you are not allowed to use tools.) The player with the highest single die score wins and takes the "1." bonus. He may also, instead, take the "all" bonus. Then all the other players, participating in the taming, take the "all" bonus. Then, the winner takes the tile and places it face down in front of himself. (The O on the back is not for the player. It just serves as a reminder for the final scoring). When the highest die scores are level, the players compare the next lower score, etc.

If there is still a draw after comparing all results, all players involved get the "all" bonus.
 The tile has to be put back into the box. If nobody has placed a people figure on the bonus tile, nobody gets the bonus. The tile has to be put into the box as well. Before you score the civilization cards, there is the mammoth scoring. The player with the most bonus tiles gets 10 points. In the case of a draw, all players involved get these points.

Name: Total Party Kill
Description:
Total Party Kill is a fast-paced and merciless game in which 2-4 players build and level up their parties of heroes, recruit mercenaries, and use spells and artifacts to fight and gain the upper hand on the other players in order to explore and conquer dangerous territories infested with monsters.

Total Party Kill comes with four different faction decks based on the comic world created by No Lands Comics.
